intro: Draconia campestris, commonly known as the field dragon's head, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, umbrella-like inflorescence. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Draconia campestris is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
